# Draft:Abu Dhabi Award for Government Excellence

The Abu Dhabi Award for Government Excellence is a government award presented every two years since 2007 by the Abu Dhabi Award for Government Excellence Office, aimed at recognizing outstanding government entities in their work. The award aims to enhance governmental performance in the Emirate of Abu Dhabi.
History of the Award
The award was established by the General Secretariat of the Executive Council of the Emirate of Abu Dhabi, which created the Abu Dhabi Award for Government Excellence Office to oversee the granting of the award. The first cycle was launched in 2006-2007, with 22 government entities from the emirate participating. The number increased to 35 in the second cycle (2008-2009), and 44 in the third cycle (2010-2011). The number reached 52 government entities in the fifth cycle of the Abu Dhabi Award for Government Excellence in 2017.
Objectives of the Award
The Abu Dhabi Award for Government Excellence aims to:
*Develop the government sector and improve performance, services, and practices by spreading the concepts of excellence.
*Promote the best practices in modern government administration by providing a guiding reference and global standards for benchmarking both locally and internationally.
*Foster and develop a spirit of positive competition within the government sector.
*Emphasize the importance of preparing and implementing strategic plans to ensure maximum efficiency and effectiveness in all government institutions.
*Motivate outstanding government departments and entities, reward exceptional government employees, and encourage creativity and professional excellence.
Logo
The sharp ends of the logoâ€™s arches represent sharp intellect and dedication to work. The shiny silver color reflects the brilliance and glow of the creative, intelligent, and proactive mind, as well as the enthusiasm of both individuals and groups. The direction of the arches towards the sky symbolizes the strong desire of the exceptional individuals to reach the highest levels and achieve the most distant goals. At the top of the arches, the golden star represents the pinnacle of success and excellence.
